Text.Value: By your efforts, Silvanus' grace can be restored to the grove. May he always share your stride.
Forgive me. You triumphed over the goblins, and that cannot have been an easy task.
I cannot imagine taking on a camp full of goblins was a simple task.
Of course. It is well-earned.
Place it among the pedestals inside our library. When the wolf glows brightest, everything in the vault below will be yours.
I hope whatever rot was lurking in her heart can be swiftly cut away.
No, thanks is not enough. May Silvanus bless you for all your days.
For someone like me? It was pretty simple, actually.
As am I. The grove will be whole again.
To be expected. I am glad you survived intact.
...I apologise. I must have some time to myself.

EditorData.NodeContext: Grieving for Halsin, his mentor and close friend

Text.Value: Let me show you on your map where you can find the cache. Take this rune - you'll need it.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gestures towards the player, offering a rune.
EditorData.NodeContext: Offering a rune-like key to the player for a reward.

Text.Value: Where is the rune? My apologies. It seems to have been... taken.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Rath searching his clothes for the rune

Text.Value: Nature is an endless cycle of death and rebirth. Silvanus' grace will return to us one day.
You've done it. You brought Halsin back. Thank you.
Fair enough. I should not have underestimated you.
All the pain Kagha caused will heal with the season's turn, as it should be.
May he rest in Summeroak forever. I...

EditorData.NodeContext: Grieving for Halsin, his mentor and close friend. Voice tapers off as his composure cracks.

Text.Value: I'm glad Halsin made it here, but I wish I could have helped more.
I... I wish it did not feel too late. This grove is corrupt, its shepherds drowned in blood.
With Halsin's return, you can feel the change in the air.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: HASMET, KAGHA DIED BECAUSE SHE BECAME A SHADOW DRUID

Text.Value: Ah, of course.
But I will leave that for Halsin to judge. He is First Druid, and I will not gainsay him as Kagha has done.
That explains... a great deal, although I suppose her true allegiances no longer matter.
And I promised you a reward, didn't I?
After cutting through a grove of druids, goblins were simple.
I am glad the goblins are no longer a threat. But where... where is Halsin?

EditorData.NodeContext: Glad the goblins are gone, but still worried about his missing friend.

Text.Value: Kagha was allied with Shadow Druids. I have proof.
It was a hell full of blood and ash.
You've done it. You brought Halsin back.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Deep, serious gratitude. But with extreme sadness since all other druids are dead.

Text.Value: What will you do now? You're basically the only druid left.
Thanks to you, the grove is whole again.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: HASMET, KAGHA WAS CONFRONTED AND PERSUADED

Text.Value: Halsin will guide us forward, and Kagha's heart will heal. I have full faith in that.
They were people, not weeds. We all suffered under Kagha's wicked leadership.
I cannot abandon this place. By Silvanus' grace, I will remain here to serve as Halsin sees fit.
Leave.
I'm just here for the reward.
Seeing Halsin gives me the strength to endure everything else. You did the right thing.
Think nothing of it. I'm glad Halsin is safe.
Forgive me. I can only offer my gratitude, and pray Silvanus protects you on your journey.
Silvanus forgive me.

EditorData.logicalname: During Attack on Den, before defeat of raiders. Other druids are dead.

Text.Value: That... explains a great deal. To think that Kagha could fall to their corruption under Silvanus' gaze.

EditorData.NodeContext: Shocked, but then turning to frustration.

Text.Value: It wasn't. So where's my reward?
You have my deepest gratitude. I promised you a reward, did I not?
If it makes you feel any better, I found proof Kagha was allied with Shadow Druids.
Now that Halsin is here, Kagha will surely see sense.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: HASMET, KAGHA WAS NEVER CONFRONTED ABOUT THE SHADOW DRUID AGENDA

Synopsis: Rath's dialog once the Tieflings win Attack on Den OR once the quest Goblin Hunt is completed. He provides a reward to the player if they have brought back Halsin.
